SEARCH
Package be.belegkarnil.game.board.spectrangle.event

Interface MisdesignListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
MisdesignAdapter
public interface MisdesignListener extends EventListener
The listener interface for receiving "interesting" misdesign events (begin, and end) during a game. The class that is interested in processing a misdesign event either implements this interface (and all the methods it contains) or extends the abstract MisdesignAdapter class (overriding only the methods of interest). The listener object created from that class is then registered in a Strategy's Strategy.register(Game) on the Game object using Game.addMisdesignListener(MisdesignListener). Please, do not forget to unregister the listener when the Strategy's Strategy.unregister(Game) method is called by using Game.removeMisdesignListener(MisdesignListener) on the Game object. A misdesign event is generated when the game ask a player to use its Strategy and an error (implementation, design, misconception) occurs. When a misdesign event occurs, the relevant method in the listener object is invoked, and the MisdesignEvent is passed to it.
Author:
Belegkarnil

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    onException(MisdesignEvent event)
    Invoked when a Strategy has badly designed and an Exception occurs.

    Invoked when a Strategy try to play an invalid Piece (not in the Player'hands).
    void
    onInvalidPosition(MisdesignEvent event)
    Invoked when a Strategy try to play at an invalid Point position (out of the board, a busy place, no adjacent place, or no matching color place)
    void
    onTimeout(MisdesignEvent event)
    Invoked when a Strategy hangs and does not select an Action Within the given time frame.

      Parameters:
